* Aircraft will need to be trimmed nose up because of the weight of the nose, so the wing will be close to its critical angle of attack and stall speed.
* Aircraft will be more stable
* Performance decreases due to the increased drag from the high angle of attack
* HIGHER stall speed (think about cruising close to critical angle of attack not far from the higher stall speed)
* HIGHER take off speed...more mass to move and get off the ground.
* Easier Stall recovery

(Pilot's Handbook of Aeronautical Knowledge 10-2)
